title: How about getting rid of the "Support" role?
body:
If anyone played back before season 1, there was no established meta.  Junglers were optional, and 2 person top lanes were actually optimal - you had to pick only certain characters if your team had a jungler on it, because it was likely you would be stuck 1v2.  

AD carries could go to any lane and didn't have to be babysat by a dedicated role.  Ashe and Sivir mid were common - Ashe especially because of her global ult.  Twitch was also a common mid because of his roam potential with stealth and was very scary once he hit six.

Bot lane was a wildcard because people would tend to go for things like Taric/Sion to chain stun, or Blitz/Ali for pinballing champs.  But any two champs could go together as long as they complemented each other.

The whole 'sit in bush for 10 minutes, don't take any farm, don't take any kills, and don't earn any gold' came about from Dreamhack in season 1, and is probably the one established thing that's remained constant since, and it's consistently been a problem to get people to actually want to play this role ever since.

For example, I love playing Janna and have since this game was in beta.  I hate being passive and feeling like I have zero impact on the game as a whole until teamfights break out, so I've been taking her Mid and Top lane since season 1, so I can build her with AP and actually do things on my own as a 'support-only' champion.

With things like morde/ziggs bot, it does change things a bit, but a lot more can be done to change it from specifically a 'support' role, into just a dual bot lane role.  Old Karma, for example, was a great duo with Melee bot laners, and in Lux's original champ spotlight, she was meant to go together with melee bot laners as well.

I normally do like the support role in other games because clutch saves are fun - but you become 100% reliant on your ally to be competent.  If you're Janna and you're laning with a first time Draven who can't CS, you might as well go AFK since you literally won't be able to do a thing to save your lane and stop the enemy team from snowballing.

After the Support Singed w/ Smite fiasco, it became clear that deviating from this hard set meta not only gets your team pissed at you, but can even get you banned from the game completely.

If one thing could be done to really make this season stand out, it would be to change the role from Support and not force ADCs to only go bot lane, and allow so-called support champions to go to other lanes to potentially solo and earn money to charge their abilities.  After the support rework in season 4, AP is actually very impactful on champs like Sona/Janna/Soraka and playing Janna with 500 AP is extremely fun and satisfying.

Being able to do this without automatically being deemed a troll would be nice, and we would likely have a lot more players who would play these characters if they weren't 100% reliant on someone else doing well.

I'd love for the meta to be more flexible, but I'm not so sure there's anything Riot can do to actively break the pattern even if they wanted to. 

That said, I'd really dislike a meta in which income flows aren't fixed. And since there's only 4 income flows each lane and the jungle one of them must be shared if you're not gonna have a support (ie somebody that is assigned no flow). And competing for income is definitely no fun at all.

There are many things they could do but they would get major backlash from some players for it especially marksmen who would have their divine place in bot lane every game challenged.

But in turn it would make the game more open to different things.

I actually tend to play support the most in dota 2 and even without a ton of gold I still feel highly impactful. Give me a force staff and I can make huge plays (or blunders).

It use to be that champs like Janna could work exceptionally well mid but then her Q damage was nerfed and she could no longer clear waves with it and some AP.

Crystal maiden on the other hand can win a 1v5 with her ult sometimes if the enemy team plays it really poorly and she is by all means a support.

Riot has been pushing a meta on the players even when they have said they were not. They could make marksmen more dependent on levels but they have not. They could provide different means for supports to get EXP and act more as a roaming class but they have not.

Not really - Braum could be (and is!) a very competent solo laner with his passive, ability to cancel projectiles, and his leap to assist in ganks or avoid them.  I've seen nearly every support champion lane solo with success - the biggest obstacle is flaming allies who immediately give up and assume the person is trolling.

Support champs have crazy amounts of utility and people seem to forget that this makes them very good vs a lot of typical damage-only champions like Yasuo/Camille/Darius.
